paper.title: Credit Risk Assessment: A Nonlinear Multi-parameter Model
paper.abstract: Modern credit risk management aims at assess the default probability (DP) of a debtor according to his historical and current financial data. Due to its prominent importance in credit loan decisions, the DP assessment becomes a research focus in the riled of financial data mining. To tackle this problem, we propose a nonlinear multi-parameter model (NMM) based on domain knowledge. Additionally, the parameters of the model are estimated using one of recent evolutionary algorithm - differential evolution (DE). In the experiment, real-world financial data is utilized to test the performance of NMM. Experimental results reveal that NMM performs much better than back-propagation neural network (BPNN).

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是开发一个非线性多参数模型（NMM）用于评估债务人的违约概率（DP），这直接关联到信用风险管理，属于金融风险管理的范畴。
